intro: Hibbertia dentata var. calva, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and serrated leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal heathlands. Hibbertia dentata var. calva is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
